title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: On end, after some opposition, obtained a warrant to get her from Lanton, and got him by the Lords removed from being tutor, and a gift of tutory to my self, which cost me a considerable  sum of money before ever I fingered any of her money, which I can not now be special in, but, as I conjecture, might have been about 12lb st.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: Lanton having served him self tutor of law to them, I counted with him afterwards, and he allowed me 2,000 mks.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: On Hallow even my family came from Blackader, my wife and children in Lanton' s coach, which I had borrowed to Smeton all night, and next day to Edinburgh.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: I went with the Merse heritors to Lanton, near Jedburgh, and was by order made prisoner, but used with much discretion, and carried from Jedburgh to Hawick, and put in the hands of the Merse militia, and when they marcht to the west, I was left with the Earle of Lothian and Teviotedale heritors.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: We visited the devastations made by Slitterick, which falls from the mountain in a tremendous  torrent into Teviot, which was quite unmoved, as the two channels lay at right angles from each other We passed the day very pleasantly with Laurie and his wife, who was an old acquaintance of Mrs Carlyle's when they lived at Lanton, the next parish to Polwarth,  where she passed her infant years.
